dublin_core.dcvalue: PURPOSE Innovations in information technology offer new opportunities for creative application of personalized tailored feedback strategies for improving dietary adherence We developed and tested a real time diet monitoring and feedback system using hand held computers The goals were to increase diet self monitoring reduce the burden of monitoring food intake and increase adherence to dietary goals within a clinical trial METHODS Participants were 33 women in the Diet Modification arm of the Women s Health Initiative WHI After using focus groups to determine system features women used the Personal Digital Assistant PDA based system for 1 month and received immediate and weekly tailored feedback The process and outcomes were evaluated using real time food records collected through the PDAs surveys and self reported food frequency questionnaires RESULTS Participants significantly increased self monitoring improved their attitudes toward self monitoring and met their dietary goals more often Reported total fat intake and percent energy from fat decreased significantly There was a modest decrease in mean caloric intake DISCUSSION The pilot study findings support the largely untapped potential of hand held computers for improving diet monitoring and diet adherence particularly within a clinical trial
